intro: Psychotria boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, black berries that are typically consumed by local bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
